title: How to Install a Car Alarm in an SUV

steps.headline: Gather information regarding your SUV's paneling and wiring.
steps.description: In particular, you will want to gather as much information as you can about your vehicle's specific wiring colors, the locations of those wires, and the wires' polarities. Knowing these things beforehand can save you a lot of time and frustration mid-installation.

steps.headline: Study your vehicle design alongside your car alarm's installation manual.
steps.description: You will need to know how your specific car alarm interfaces with your SUV. Plan out the installation locations and wiring routes beforehand in order to save time later.

steps.headline: Check your SUV for any problems before beginning installation.
steps.description: In particular, make sure that your doors trigger the "door ajar" light on the dashboard when they are open. In the case that a door does not trigger the light, there is a good chance that the door won't trigger the car alarm.

steps.headline: Remove the necessary panels in your vehicle depending on the vehicle model and your car alarm model.
Look under the hood of your SUV and choose a location for the placement of your car alarm's siren.
steps.description: Once you have a suitable location, mount it securely according to the instructions specific to your car alarm. You can find those instructions in the car alarm's manual.

steps.headline: Look around the interior of your SUV and locate a suitable mount area for your car alarm near the dashboard.
steps.description: Try to install the car alarm in a hidden place.

steps.headline: Wire the valet switch, LED light, and external antenna that come with the alarm.
steps.description: All of these alarm component wiring instructions should be included in your car alarm manual. Make sure you pay attention to where the wires should be cut or altered. It is strongly recommended that you test wire polarities before making connections.

steps.headline: Connect the car alarm power wire directly to the vehicle's battery under the hood.
Install the car alarm's shock detector and door lock mechanisms.
steps.description: The car alarm manual should explain how to do this, but the wiring can grow tricky at this step. If further assistance is needed, it is recommended that you contact a technical advisor.

steps.headline: Replace the panels in your SUV.
Walk through your car alarm's testing instructions in the manual.
steps.description: If you encounter any problems with the alarm, troubleshoot them as soon as possible.
